sceneDescription.title: Lygia's Morning Prayer in Christian Household

setting.time: 64 AD, dawn breaking, golden rays of early morning sun
setting.location: Interior of patrician villa, atrium with central impluvium pool
setting.weather: Clear morning with gentle warmth beginning to penetrate stone walls

characters.appearance: Lygia, young woman of twenty, princess of Lugii tribe, delicate Germanic features, long blonde hair in simple braid
characters.clothing: Simple white linen tunic, no jewelry except small fish pendant hidden beneath fabric, bare feet
characters.position: Kneeling beside impluvium pool in Plautius household atrium
characters.action: Drawing sign of fish in water surface while whispering Christian prayer, early morning devotion

scene.mainElements: Rectangular impluvium pool reflecting morning light, marble columns supporting roof opening, geometric mosaic floor patterns in black and white
scene.details: Golden sunbeams streaming through compluvium opening casting long diagonal shadows across floor, oil lamps still burning in wall niches, fish symbol briefly visible in rippling water before fading, bronze brazier with dying embers, carved marble dolphins at pool corners, Christian cross scratched faintly into marble edge
scene.background: Doorways leading to other rooms showing glimpses of furniture and wall paintings, garden courtyard visible through colonnade with morning light on plants
scene.atmosphere: Peaceful morning ritual, soft interplay of light and shadow on marble surfaces, cool stone contrasting with warming air, gentle sounds of water drops echoing

composition.cameraAngle: Medium shot from across the pool, slightly elevated
composition.focus: Figure reflected in pool water with golden light streaming around her
composition.depth: Foreground pool reflections, middle ground kneeling figure and columns, background garden courtyard in soft morning light
